form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Begich (for himself and Mrs. Murray) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To enhance Social Security benefits for children, divorced spouses, and widows and widowers, and for other purposes.

subsection.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Retirement and Income Security Enhancements (RAISE) Act
.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 2. Improving benefits for divorced spouses, widows, widowers, and surviving divorced spouses.
Sec. 3. Extended benefit eligibility for children who are full-time students.
Sec. 4. Establishment of payroll surtax for high-income individuals.
Sec. 5. Inclusion of surplus earnings in social security benefit formula.

section.header: Improving benefits for divorced spouses, widows, widowers, and surviving divorced spouses

subsection.header: Expansion of benefits for divorced spouses

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(G), by striking 10 years and inserting 5 years; and
by amending paragraph (2) to read as follows:
Except as provided in subsections (k)(5) and (q), a wife's insurance benefit for each month shall be equal to—

clause.text: in the case of a wife (as defined in section 216(b)), one-half of the primary insurance amount of her husband for such month; or

in the case of a divorced wife (as defined in section 216(d)), the applicable percentage (as determined under subparagraph (B)) of one-half of the primary insurance amount of her former husband for such month.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A)(ii), the applicable percentage shall be equal to 100 percent reduced by 10 percentage points for each year in the period immediately before the date the divorce became effective in which the divorced wife was married to her former husband that is less than 10 years.
in paragraph (1)(G), by striking 10 years and inserting 5 years; and
by amending paragraph (2) to read as follows:
Except as provided in subsections (k)(5) and (q), a husband's insurance benefit for each month shall be equal to—

clause.text: in the case of a husband (as defined in section 216(f)), one-half of the primary insurance amount of his wife for such month; or

in the case of a divorced husband (as defined in section 216(d)), the applicable percentage (as determined under subparagraph (B)) of one-half of the primary insurance amount of his former wife for such month.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A)(ii), the applicable percentage shall be equal to 100 percent reduced by 10 percentage points for each year in the period immediately before the date the divorce became effective in which the divorced husband was married to his former wife that is less than 10 years.

paragraph.header: Reduction of benefit for individuals entitled to simultaneous benefits

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3)—

section.header: Establishment of payroll surtax for high-income individuals

subsection.text: Section 1401 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d), and
by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Additional tax for old-Age, survivors, and disability insurance

paragraph.text: In addition to the taxes imposed by the preceding subsections, there is hereby imposed on every individual for each taxable year beginning after December 31, 2014, a tax equal to 4 percent of additional self-employment income for such taxable year.
For purposes of paragraph (1), the term additional self-employment income means, for any taxable year, the amount (not less than zero) equal to the excess of—

subparagraph.text: the sum of self-employment income (determined without regard to section 1402(b)(1)) for the taxable year and wages (as defined in section 3121(a), determined without regard to paragraph (1) thereof) paid to such individual during such taxable year, over
the sum of the additional wages (as defined in section 3101(c)(2)) paid to such individual for the taxable year and the amount determined under paragraph (3) for the taxable year.

paragraph.continuation-text: Rules similar to the rules of subparagraph (A) of the second sentence of section 1402(b) shall apply for purposes of determining wages under clause (i).

paragraph.text: The amount determined under this paragraph is an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: in the case of a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2014, and before January 1, 2016, $400,000, and
in the case of any taxable year beginning after December 31, 2015, the product of—

clause.text: the quotient obtained by dividing—

subclause.text: the national average wage index (as defined in section 209(k)(1)) for the calendar year which is 2 years before the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, by
the national average wage index for calendar year 2013.

subsection.text: Section 3101 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d), and
by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Additional tax for old-Age, survivors, and disability insurance

paragraph.text: In addition to the taxes imposed by the preceding subsections, there is hereby imposed on the income of every individual a tax equal to 2 percent of additional wages (as defined in paragraph (2)) which are received with respect to employment during any calendar year beginning after December 31, 2014.

For purposes of paragraph (1), the term additional wages has the same meaning given the term wages under section 3121(a) (determined without regard to paragraph (1) thereof), except that such term shall not include that amount of remuneration that is less than—

subparagraph.text: for calendar year 2015, $400,000, and
for any calendar year after 2015, the product of—

clause.text: the quotient obtained by dividing—

subclause.text: the national average wage index (as defined in section 209(k)(1)) for the second preceding calendar year, by
the national average wage index for calendar year 2013.

subsection.text: Section 3111 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Additional tax for old-Age, survivors, and disability insurance

paragraph.text: In addition to the taxes imposed by subsections (a) and (b), there is hereby imposed on every employer an excise tax, with respect to having individuals in his employ, equal to 2 percent of additional wages (as defined in paragraph (2)) paid by the employer with respect to employment during any calendar year beginning after December 31, 2014.
For purposes of paragraph (1), the term additional wages has the same meaning given such term under section 3101(c).
Section 3201 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d), and
by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: In addition to the taxes imposed by the preceding subsections, there is hereby imposed on the income of each employee a tax equal to 2 percent of additional compensation (as defined in paragraph (2)) received by such employee during any calendar year beginning after December 31, 2014, for services rendered by such employee.

For purposes of paragraph (1), the term additional compensation has the same meaning given the term compensation under section 3231(e) (determined without regard to paragraph (2) thereof), except that such term shall not include that amount of remuneration that is less than—

subparagraph.text: for calendar year 2015, $400,000, and
for any calendar year after 2015, the product of—

clause.text: the quotient obtained by dividing—

subclause.text: the national average wage index (as defined in section 209(k)(1)) for the second preceding calendar year, by
the national average wage index for calendar year 2013.

paragraph.text: Section 3211 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d), and
by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection:

subsection.text: In addition to the taxes imposed by the preceding subsections, there is hereby imposed on the income of each employee representative a tax equal to 4 percent of additional compensation (as defined under section 3201(c)) received by such employee representative during any calendar year beginning after December 31, 2014, for services rendered by such employee representative.

paragraph.text: Section 3221 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: In addition to the taxes imposed by subsections (a) and (b), there is hereby imposed on every employer an excise tax, with respect to having individuals in his employ, equal to 2 percent of additional compensation (as defined under section 3201(c)) paid by such employer during any calendar year beginning after December 31, 2014, for services rendered to such employer.

section.header: Inclusion of surplus earnings in social security benefit formula

subsection.header: Inclusion of surplus average indexed monthly earnings in determination of primary insurance amounts
subsection.text: Section 215(a)(1)(A) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 415(a)(1)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking and at the end;
in clause (iii), by inserting and at the end; and
by inserting after clause (iii) the following new clause:

clause.text: 2 percent of the individual’s surplus average indexed monthly earnings,

paragraph.text: Section 215(b)(1) of such Act ( 42 U.S.C. 415(b)(1) ) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting basic before average; and

in subparagraph (A), by striking paragraph (3) and inserting paragraph (3)(A) and by inserting before the comma the following: to the extent such total does not exceed the contribution and benefit base for the applicable year.
Section 215(b)(1) of such Act (as amended by paragraph (1)) is amended—

clause.text: by inserting (A) after (b)(1) ; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
An individual’s surplus average indexed monthly earnings shall be equal to the quotient obtained by dividing—

subclause.text: the total (after adjustment under paragraph (3)(B)) of such individual’s surplus earnings (determined under clause (ii)) for such individual’s benefit computation years (determined under paragraph (2)), by
the number of months in those years.

clause.text: For purposes of clause (i) and paragraph (3)(B), an individual’s surplus earnings for a benefit computation year are the total of such individual’s additional wages (as defined in section 209(l)) paid in and additional self-employment income (as defined in section 209(m)) credited to such benefit computation year, to the extent such total does not exceed the amount determined for such year under clause (iii).
For purposes of clause (ii), the amount determined under this clause is—

subclause.text: in the case of a benefit computation year beginning after December 31, 2014, and before January 1, 2016, $500,000; and
in the case of any benefit computation year beginning on or after January 1, 2016, the product of $500,000 and the quotient obtained by dividing—

item.text: the national average wage index (as defined in section 209(k)(1)) for the calendar year which is 2 years before the calendar year in which the benefit computation year begins, by
the national average wage index for calendar year 2013.

subparagraph.text: The heading for section 215(b) of such Act is amended by striking Average Indexed Monthly Earnings and inserting Basic Average Indexed Monthly Earnings; Surplus Average Indexed Monthly Earnings.

paragraph.header: Adjustment of surplus earnings for purposes of determining surplus AIME
paragraph.text: Section 215(b)(3) of such Act ( 42 U.S.C. 415(b)(3) ) is amended—

subparagraph (C) and by inserting and determination of basic average indexed monthly income after paragraph (2) ;

For purposes of determining under paragraph (1)(B) an individual’s surplus average indexed monthly earnings, the individual’s surplus earnings (described in paragraph (1)(B)(ii)) for a benefit computation year shall be deemed to be equal to the product of—

clause.text: the individual’s surplus earnings for such year (as determined without regard to this subparagraph), and
the quotient described in subparagraph (A)(ii).

paragraph.text: by striking and at the end of clause (ii);

clause.text: for each such calendar month after 2014, the amount which is creditable as such individual's additional wages under section 209(l) of the Social Security Act.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to individuals who initially become eligible (within the meaning of section 215(a)(3)(B) of the Social Security Act ( 42 U.S.C. 415(a)(3)(B) )) for old-age or disability insurance benefits under title II of the Social Security Act, or who die (before becoming eligible for such benefits), in any calendar year after 2014.
